html: Jehovah’s initial words to Hezekiah through his prophet—“Be not afraid”—repeat the same message Jehovah gave Ahaz under similar dire circumstances a generation earlier (Isaiah 7:4). So long as the king keeps the terms of the Davidic Covenant, Jehovah will intervene to deliver his people. In other words, despite what appears, this is a chance for the king to serve as his people’s proxy savior and for the people to be reborn on a higher spiritual level by proving loyal to their king under duress. Jehovah can cause the king of Assyria to depart and also raise up a sword or enemy against him (v 38).
